summary: Frontend testing of Approval Workflow Guide documentation screenshots completed successfully. All 14 approval workflow screenshots are now displaying actual images instead of placeholders. Screenshots include Creator workflow (content generation, writing, analysis, submit, pending status), Manager workflow (approval queue, review, approve/reject actions, filter), and Notifications (creator approved/rejected, manager new/queue).
passed_tests: Demo admin login successful with credentials demo-admin@contentry.com / DemoAdmin!123
Approval Workflow Guide at /contentry/documentation/approval loads correctly
Page title 'Content Approval Workflow Guide' displayed
15 total images on page (14 screenshots + 1 logo)
0 placeholder texts ('Screenshot not yet captured') found - all screenshots loaded
0 'Capture Screenshot' buttons found - no missing screenshots
14 Interactive badges found indicating loaded screenshots
Creator workflow section displays actual screenshot of Content Generation page
Manager workflow section displays actual screenshot of Approval Queue page
Notifications section displays actual screenshot of Notifications page
Screenshot hover overlay 'Click to open in app' is working correctly
Backend API /api/v1/documentation/screenshots/{pageId} returns valid image data
DocScreenshot component correctly fetches and displays base64 image data
seed_data_creation: None - screenshots were captured by backend scripts and stored in MongoDB
context_for_next_testing_agent: All 14 approval workflow screenshots are now captured and displaying correctly in the documentation. The DocScreenshot component fetches images from /api/v1/documentation/screenshots/{pageId} endpoint. Screenshots include: creator-content-generation, creator-writing-content, creator-analysis-scores, creator-submit-approval, creator-pending-status, manager-approval-queue, manager-review-content, manager-approve-action, manager-reject-feedback, manager-filter-status, creator-notification-approved, creator-notification-rejected, manager-notification-new, manager-notification-queue. The hover overlay 'Click to open in app' indicates screenshots are interactive and link to the actual app pages.
